{"step_by_step_thinking": "The Golgi tendon organ is a proprioceptor that senses changes in muscle tension. It lies at the interface between a muscle and its tendon, known as the musculotendinous junction. The Golgi tendon organ provides the sensory component of the Golgi tendon reflex. Based on this information, the Golgi tendon organ detects muscle tension.", "answer_choice": "A"}
